member.name: IAMTuner.ChannelMinMax

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ChannelMinMax method retrieves the highest and lowest channels available.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the lowest channel.
Pointer to a variable that receives the highest channel.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMTuner.GetAvailableModes

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAvailableModes method retrieves the tuner's supported modes.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives any combination of the values as specified in the enumeration.

member.name: IAMTuner.get_Channel

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_Channel method retrieves the channel to which the tuner is set.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the channel. For frequencies, see International Analog TV Tuning

param.name: plVideoSubChannel
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives either the video subchannel, or one of the following flags:

param.name: plAudioSubChannel
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives either the audio subchannel, or one of the following flags:

member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

member.name: IAMTuner.get_CountryCode

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_CountryCode method retrieves the country/region code that establishes the current channel-to-frequency mapping.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the country/region code currently in use by the TV Tuner filter.
member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

The get_Mode method retrieves the current mode on a multifunction tuner.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives a flag indicating the current mode setting. The possible values are defined in the enumeration.
member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

member.name: IAMTuner.put_Channel

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The put_Channel method sets the TV channel.

member.param: Predefined video subchannel value. Specify AMTUNER_SUBCHAN_NO_TUNE for no tuning or AMTUNER_SUBCHAN_DEFAULT for default subchannel. Meaningful only for satellite broadcasts.
Predefined audio subchannel value. Specify AMTUNER_SUBCHAN_NO_TUNE for no tuning or AMTUNER_SUBCHAN_DEFAULT for default subchannel. Meaningful only for satellite broadcasts.
member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The put_CountryCode method sets the country/region code to establish the frequency to use.

member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The put_Mode method sets a multifunction tuner to the specified mode.

param.name: lMode
param.para: Flag indicating which mode to switch to. Possible values are defined in the enumeration.
You can also set the mode to digital TV if the card supports it. To do this, define AMTUNER_MODE_DTV with a value of 0x0010.

member.name: IAMTuner.RegisterNotificationCallBack

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The RegisterNotificationCallBack method enables an object to receive event notifications when the tuner changes state.
This method is not implemented.

member.param: Pointer to the interface that will receive the event notifications.
Flag indicating that an event has occurred.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SignalPresent method retrieves the strength of the signal on a given channel.

param.name: plSignalStrength
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a value indicating whether a signal is present on the current channel. Can be one of the following values.
A value of AMTUNER_HASNOSIGNALSTRENGTH means the signal strength cannot be determined at this time.

The UnRegisterNotificationCallBack method unregisters an object for event notifications.
This method is not implemented.

member.param: Pointer to the interface that was specified in a previous call to RegisterNotificationCallBack.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IAMTuner interface controls a TV tuner. This interface is the base class for the interface, which inherits all of the IAMTuner methods. For more information on controlling a TV tuner using Microsoft DirectShow, see the IAMTVTuner documentation.
